get.description: List management groups for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-01-01-preview.

parameters.name: Cache-Control
parameters.description: Indicates whether the request should utilize any caches. Populate the header with 'no-cache' value to bypass existing caches.

parameters.name: $skiptoken
parameters.description:
Page continuation token is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. 
If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a token parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

schema.description: Describes the result of the request to list management groups.

id.description: The fully qualified ID for the management group.  For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

type.description: The type of the resource. For example, Microsoft.Management/managementGroups

name.description: The name of the management group. For example, 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: The generic properties of a management group.

tenantId.description: The AAD Tenant ID associated with the management group. For example, 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

displayName.description: The friendly name of the management group.

@nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

get.description: Get the details of the management group.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Management Group ID.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-01-01-preview.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: The $expand=children query string parameter allows clients to request inclusion of children in the response payload.  $expand=path includes the path from the root group to the current group.  $expand=ancestors includes the ancestor Ids of the current group.

parameters.name: $recurse
parameters.description: The $recurse=true query string parameter allows clients to request inclusion of entire hierarchy in the response payload. Note that  $expand=children must be passed up if $recurse is set to true.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: A filter which allows the exclusion of subscriptions from results (i.e. '$filter=children.childType ne Subscription')

parameters.name: Cache-Control
parameters.description: Indicates whether the request should utilize any caches. Populate the header with 'no-cache' value to bypass existing caches.

put.description:
Create or update a management group.
If a management group is already created and a subsequent create request is issued with different properties, the management group properties will be updated.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Management Group ID.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-01-01-preview.

parameters.name: Cache-Control
parameters.description: Indicates whether the request should utilize any caches. Populate the header with 'no-cache' value to bypass existing caches.

schema.description: The results of Azure-AsyncOperation.

id.description: The fully qualified ID for the management group.  For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

type.description: The type of the resource.  For example, Microsoft.Management/managementGroups

name.description: The name of the management group. For example, 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

status.description: The current status of the asynchronous operation performed . For example, Running, Succeeded, Failed

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: The generic properties of a management group.

tenantId.description: The AAD Tenant ID associated with the management group. For example, 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

displayName.description: The friendly name of the management group.

Location.description:
URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.
The URI should return a 202 until the operation reaches a terminal state and 200 once it reaches a terminal state.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#202-accepted-and-location-headers

Azure-AsyncOperation.description:
URL for checking the ongoing status of the operation.
To get the status of the asynchronous operation, send a GET request to the URL in Azure-AsyncOperation header value.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#asynchronous-operations

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Management Group ID.

parameters.description: Indicates whether the request should utilize any caches. Populate the header with 'no-cache' value to bypass existing caches.

get.description: Gets all the hierarchy settings defined at the Management Group level. Settings can only be set on the root Management Group of the hierarchy.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Management Group ID.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-01-01-preview.

schema.description: Lists all hierarchy settings.

id.description: The fully qualified ID for the settings object.  For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/settings/default.

type.description: The type of the resource.  For example, Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/settings.

name.description: The name of the object. In this case, default.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: The generic properties of hierarchy settings.

tenantId.description: The AAD Tenant ID associated with the hierarchy settings. For example, 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

requireAuthorizationForGroupCreation.description: Indicates whether RBAC access is required upon group creation under the root Management Group. If set to true, user will require Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/write action on the root Management Group scope in order to create new Groups directly under the root. This will prevent new users from creating new Management Groups, unless they are given access.

defaultManagementGroup.description: Settings that sets the default Management Group under which new subscriptions get added in this tenant. For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/defaultGroup

@nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

post.description: Checks if the specified management group name is valid and unique

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-01-01-preview.

parameters.name: checkNameAvailabilityRequest
parameters.description: Management group name availability check parameters.

schema.description: Management group name availability check parameters.

name.description: the name to check for availability

type.description: fully qualified resource type which includes provider namespace

schema.description: Describes the result of the request to check management group name availability.

nameAvailable.description: Required. True indicates name is valid and available. False indicates the name is invalid, unavailable, or both.

reason.description: Required if nameAvailable == false. Invalid indicates the name provided does not match the resource provider's naming requirements (incorrect length, unsupported characters, etc.) AlreadyExists indicates that the name is already in use and is therefore unavailable.

message.description: Required if nameAvailable == false. Localized. If reason == invalid, provide the user with the reason why the given name is invalid, and provide the resource naming requirements so that the user can select a valid name. If reason == AlreadyExists, explain that is already in use, and direct them to select a different name.

post.description: List all entities (Management Groups, Subscriptions, etc.) for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-01-01-preview.

parameters.name: $skiptoken
parameters.description:
Page continuation token is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. 
If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a token parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of entities to skip over when retrieving results. Passing this in will override $skipToken.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of elements to return when retrieving results. Passing this in will override $skipToken.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the fields to include in the response. Can include any combination of Name,DisplayName,Type,ParentDisplayNameChain,ParentChain, e.g. '$select=Name,DisplayName,Type,ParentDisplayNameChain,ParentNameChain'. When specified the $select parameter can override select in $skipToken.

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description:
The $search parameter is used in conjunction with the $filter parameter to return three different outputs depending on the parameter passed in. 
With $search=AllowedParents the API will return the entity info of all groups that the requested entity will be able to reparent to as determined by the user's permissions.
With $search=AllowedChildren the API will return the entity info of all entities that can be added as children of the requested entity.
With $search=ParentAndFirstLevelChildren the API will return the parent and  first level of children that the user has either direct access to or indirect access via one of their descendants.
With $search=ParentOnly the API will return only the group if the user has access to at least one of the descendants of the group.
With $search=ChildrenOnly the API will return only the first level of children of the group entity info specified in $filter.  The user must have direct access to the children entities or one of it's descendants for it to show up in the results.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter parameter allows you to filter on the the name or display name fields. You can check for equality on the name field (e.g. name eq '{entityName}')  and you can check for substrings on either the name or display name fields(e.g. contains(name, '{substringToSearch}'), contains(displayName, '{substringToSearch')). Note that the '{entityName}' and '{substringToSearch}' fields are checked case insensitively.

parameters.name: $view
parameters.description: The view parameter allows clients to filter the type of data that is returned by the getEntities call.

parameters.name: groupName
parameters.description: A filter which allows the get entities call to focus on a particular group (i.e. "$filter=name eq 'groupName'")

parameters.name: Cache-Control
parameters.description: Indicates whether the request should utilize any caches. Populate the header with 'no-cache' value to bypass existing caches.

schema.description: Describes the result of the request to view entities.

id.description: The fully qualified ID for the entity.  For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

type.description: The type of the resource. For example, Microsoft.Management/managementGroups

name.description: The name of the entity. For example, 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: The generic properties of an entity.

tenantId.description: The AAD Tenant ID associated with the entity. For example, 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

displayName.description: The friendly name of the management group.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: (Optional) The ID of the parent management group.

id.description: The fully qualified ID for the parent management group.  For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: The users specific permissions to this item.

inheritedPermissions.title: Inherited Permissions
inheritedPermissions.description: The users specific permissions to this item.

numberOfChildren.title: Number of Children
numberOfChildren.description: Number of children is the number of Groups and Subscriptions that are exactly one level underneath the current Group.

numberOfChildGroups.title: Number of Child Groups
numberOfChildGroups.description: Number of children is the number of Groups that are exactly one level underneath the current Group.

parentDisplayNameChain.description: The parent display name chain from the root group to the immediate parent

parentNameChain.description: The parent name chain from the root group to the immediate parent

count.description: Total count of records that match the filter

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

HierarchySettings.description: Settings defined at the Management Group scope.

id.description: The fully qualified ID for the settings object.  For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/settings/default.

name.description: The name of the object. In this case, default.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: The generic properties of hierarchy settings.

tenantId.description: The AAD Tenant ID associated with the hierarchy settings. For example, 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

requireAuthorizationForGroupCreation.description: Indicates whether RBAC access is required upon group creation under the root Management Group. If set to true, user will require Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/write action on the root Management Group scope in order to create new Groups directly under the root. This will prevent new users from creating new Management Groups, unless they are given access.

defaultManagementGroup.description: Settings that sets the default Management Group under which new subscriptions get added in this tenant. For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/defaultGroup

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2018-01-01-preview.

ExpandParameter.name: $expand
ExpandParameter.description: The $expand=children query string parameter allows clients to request inclusion of children in the response payload.  $expand=path includes the path from the root group to the current group.  $expand=ancestors includes the ancestor Ids of the current group.

RecurseParameter.name: $recurse
RecurseParameter.description: The $recurse=true query string parameter allows clients to request inclusion of entire hierarchy in the response payload. Note that  $expand=children must be passed up if $recurse is set to true.

schema.description: Management group patch parameters.

displayName.description: The friendly name of the management group.

parentGroupId.description: (Optional) The fully qualified ID for the parent management group.  For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/0000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000

FilterParameter.name: $filter
FilterParameter.description: A filter which allows the exclusion of subscriptions from results (i.e. '$filter=children.childType ne Subscription')

EntityFilterParameter.name: $filter
EntityFilterParameter.description: The filter parameter allows you to filter on the the name or display name fields. You can check for equality on the name field (e.g. name eq '{entityName}')  and you can check for substrings on either the name or display name fields(e.g. contains(name, '{substringToSearch}'), contains(displayName, '{substringToSearch')). Note that the '{entityName}' and '{substringToSearch}' fields are checked case insensitively.

SelectParameter.name: $select
SelectParameter.description: This parameter specifies the fields to include in the response. Can include any combination of Name,DisplayName,Type,ParentDisplayNameChain,ParentChain, e.g. '$select=Name,DisplayName,Type,ParentDisplayNameChain,ParentNameChain'. When specified the $select parameter can override select in $skipToken.

SearchParameter.name: $search
SearchParameter.description:
The $search parameter is used in conjunction with the $filter parameter to return three different outputs depending on the parameter passed in. 
With $search=AllowedParents the API will return the entity info of all groups that the requested entity will be able to reparent to as determined by the user's permissions.
With $search=AllowedChildren the API will return the entity info of all entities that can be added as children of the requested entity.
With $search=ParentAndFirstLevelChildren the API will return the parent and  first level of children that the user has either direct access to or indirect access via one of their descendants.
With $search=ParentOnly the API will return only the group if the user has access to at least one of the descendants of the group.
With $search=ChildrenOnly the API will return only the first level of children of the group entity info specified in $filter.  The user must have direct access to the children entities or one of it's descendants for it to show up in the results.

GroupNameParameter.name: groupName
GroupNameParameter.description: A filter which allows the get entities call to focus on a particular group (i.e. "$filter=name eq 'groupName'")

schema.description: Parameters for creating or updating Management Group settings

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: The properties of the request to create or update Management Group settings

requireAuthorizationForGroupCreation.description: Indicates whether RBAC access is required upon group creation under the root Management Group. If set to true, user will require Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/write action on the root Management Group scope in order to create new Groups directly under the root. This will prevent new users from creating new Management Groups, unless they are given access.

defaultManagementGroup.description: Settings that sets the default Management Group under which new subscriptions get added in this tenant. For example, /providers/Microsoft.Management/managementGroups/defaultGroup

CheckNameAvailabilityParameter.name: checkNameAvailabilityRequest
CheckNameAvailabilityParameter.description: Management group name availability check parameters.

schema.description: Management group name availability check parameters.

name.description: the name to check for availability

type.description: fully qualified resource type which includes provider namespace

SkipParameter.name: $skip
SkipParameter.description: Number of entities to skip over when retrieving results. Passing this in will override $skipToken.

TopParameter.name: $top
TopParameter.description: Number of elements to return when retrieving results. Passing this in will override $skipToken.

SkipTokenParameter.name: $skiptoken
SkipTokenParameter.description:
Page continuation token is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. 
If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a token parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

CacheControlHeader.name: Cache-Control
CacheControlHeader.description: Indicates whether the request should utilize any caches. Populate the header with 'no-cache' value to bypass existing caches.

EntityViewParameter.name: $view
EntityViewParameter.description: The view parameter allows clients to filter the type of data that is returned by the getEntities call.
